allow: Bash(open:*)
Bash(chmod:*)
Bash(python3:*)
Bash(swiftc:*)
Bash(shortcuts list:*)
Bash(sw_vers:*)
Bash(defaults read:*)
Bash(defaults:*)
Bash(pluginkit:*)
Bash(shortcuts run:*)
Bash(nm:*)
Bash(# Check if there''s an XPC service for Focus ls /System/Library/XPCServices/)
Bash(# Check the Focus status item in the menu bar - any writable plist defaults read com.apple.focus)
Bash(# Look at what strings are in the FocusEngine framework strings /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/FocusEngine.framework/Versions/A/FocusEngine)
Bash(# Read the DoNotDisturb plist defaults read ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.donotdisturbd.plist)
Bash(# Check what process manages Focus/DND launchctl list)
Bash(# Check for focusctl in more locations find /usr /usr/local /opt /System/Library/CoreServices -name ""*focus*"" -o -name ""*dnd*"")
Bash(# Check what the donotdisturbd binary is and if it has any useful command line find /System -name ""donotdisturbd"")
Bash(# Look at what FocusEngine exports via strings \(faster path\) strings /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/FocusEngine.framework/Versions/A/FocusEngine)

Bash(# See if there''s a focusctl or any focus-related tool available on PATH which focusctl ; which dndctl ; which focusd # Also check if ''shortcuts'' can trigger DND directly shortcuts list --show-identifiers)
Bash(# Try nm on the DoNotDisturbKit to find class/method names nm /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturbKit.framework/Versions/A/DoNotDisturbKit)
Bash(# Try to get Objective-C class names from DoNotDisturbKit using otool otool -ov /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturbKit.framework/Versions/A/DoNotDisturbKit)
Bash(# Check the DoNotDisturbServer strings more specifically strings /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturbServer.framework/Versions/A/DoNotDisturbServer)
Bash(# What does the ""Pause einlegen"" shortcut do? Check its plist find ~/Library -name ""*.shortcut"" -o -name ""*.wflow"")
Bash(# Use otool to get class names and method names from DoNotDisturbKit otool -ov /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturbKit.framework/Versions/A/DoNotDisturbKit)

Bash(# Check DoNotDisturb.framework \(not DoNotDisturbKit\) - this may be the client-facing one ls /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturb.framework/Versions/A/DoNotDisturb && \\ otool -ov /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturb.framework/Versions/A/DoNotDisturb)

Bash(# These frameworks have no actual binaries - they''re stub frameworks # The DoNotDisturb.intentdefinition file might tell us about Siri intents plutil -p /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/DoNotDisturb.framework/PlugIns/DoNotDisturbIntents.appex/Contents/Resources/Base.lproj/DoNotDisturb.intentdefinition)
Bash(# Check if there''s a Focus intent definition anywhere find /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/Focus.framework -type f find /System/Library/PrivateFrameworks/FocusEngine.framework -type f)
Bash(plutil:*)

Bash(# Check if there''s a way to invoke shortcuts intents via osascript # Also check for the ""Fokus"" Shortcut action that might toggle DND # Look for the Shortcuts built-in actions related to Focus find /System/Library -name ""*.intentdefinition"" | xargs grep -l ""Focus\\|DoNotDisturb"")
Bash(# Check the Shortcuts app for built-in Focus actions find /System/Applications -name ""Shortcuts.app"" -type d)
Bash(echo:*)
Bash(osascript:*)
Bash(log show:*)
Bash(/usr/bin/log show:*)
Bash(npm install:*)
